data.title: Operating Partners Forum
data.meta_description: The premier PE operations event of the industry attracting the largest community of operating partners in North America. Find out more.
data.text:
Mark is a senior operating executive and member of Gryphon’s Operations Resources Group where he helps portfolio companies implement best practices in operational finance, accounting, planning and analytics, tax, and information technology, with a focus on growth, scalability, efficiency, and governance.

Prior to joining Gryphon, Mark was President & COO of NV5 Global, where he led the geospatial technology platform of this publicly traded engineering services firm, expanding capabilities and market reach through the acquisition and integration of leading technologies. Prior to NV5, Mark’s private equity experience included COO/CFO roles of technology leader Quantum Spatial and pharmaceutical producer Alcami. Mark is the former CFO of GE Healthcare Medical Devices and former Global Controller for GE Energy Products. Mark started his career in public accounting with KPMG.

Headquartered in San Francisco, Gryphon Investors is a leading middle-market investment firm focused on competitively advantaged companies in the Business Services, Consumer, Healthcare, Industrial Growth, and Software sectors. Gryphon’s integrated Deal-Ops business model includes highly experienced investment professionals who work alongside full-time senior operating executives with general management, human capital, IT, treasury, finance and accounting expertise. Gryphon’s differentiated model has been a critical driver of the firm’s stable returns, significant alpha creation, and zero loss ratio since 2008. With approximately $9 billion of assets under management, Gryphon’s private equity funds target investments of $50 million to $500 million while the junior capital fund targets investments ranging from $5 million to $25 million. Recently, Gryphon was recognized by Inc. Magazine as a top 2023 Founder-Friendly Investor. Additional information on Gryphon can be found at: https://www.gryphon-inv.com/

Nadeem is a Partner in CrossCountry Consulting’s national Private Equity practice based in Dallas, Texas. A hands-on M&A leader with over 20 years of experience across the transaction lifecycle – from diligence to post-close transformation – he has particular expertise in infusing analytics and data-driven decision-making into an organization’s business processes to drive revenue growth and increase operational efficiency.

Prior to CrossCountry, Nadeem was a Managing Director in KPMG’s Deal Advisory and Strategy practice, providing technology strategy, digital transformation, and performance improvement support to private equity firms and their portfolio companies before joining West Monroe’s Technology Transaction Services as Senior Partner.

Preceding his consulting career, Nadeem spent many years working at product technology companies, including one which he co-founded, where he held roles from software engineer to CTO, giving him a unique perspective that he now brings to the technology M&A space.

Nadeem earned his bachelor’s degree from the University of Manitoba, Canada, and a master’s and Ph.D. in electrical engineering from Rice University.

CrossCountry Consulting is a leading provider of specialized finance, operations, and technology advisory services. As a trusted advisor to Fortune 500 companies, emerging growth market leaders, and private equity sponsors, the firm solves today’s most pressing challenges and creates present and future enterprise value through accounting and risk, technology-enabled transformation, and transaction solutions. Headquartered in Washington, D.C., CrossCountry has employees across the United States and in strategic international locations. With an unwavering commitment to providing a better experience, they are regularly recognized as a best place to work. Learn more at crosscountry-consulting.com.

Arvind leads Mubadala Performance Partners, a dedicated team of senior specialized operating partners who deliver holistic transformation which maximizes the value creation potential of our portfolio companies.

In this role, he works across sectors partnering with portfolio company management teams and boards at companies such as Nova Chemicals, CEPSA, and GlobalFoundries amongst others. In addition, he is a board member of CoolIT Systems, which specializes in scalable liquid cooling solutions for demanding computing environments.

Arvind has 20+ years of transformation experience across a range of sectors. Before joining Mubadala, he led performance transformations for numerous clients across the Industrial, Automotive, Energy, and Financial sectors at McKinsey. Subsequently, Arvind joined Bridgewater Associates, and championed a cross-functional transformation process, including across commercial and operations.

Arvind holds a Bachelor’s degree in Engineering from University of Michigan at Ann Arbor and an MBA from Dartmouth College.

Arvind holds a Bachelor’s degree in Engineering from University of Michigan at Ann Arbor and MBA from Dartmouth College.

Mubadala Investment Company is a sovereign investor managing a global portfolio, aimed at generating sustainable financial returns for the Government of Abu Dhabi.

Mubadala’s $276 billion (AED 1015 billion) portfolio spans six continents with interests in multiple sectors and asset classes. It leverages its deep sectoral expertise and long-standing partnerships to drive sustainable growth and profit, while supporting the continued diversification and global integration of the economy of the United Arab Emirates. For more information about Mubadala Investment Company, please visit: www.mubadala.com

Experience:

Mr. Ashmore is Senior Vice President – Reporting & Insights in Portfolio Dynamics Group, a team dedicated to supporting Grain’s due diligence processes and portfolio company integration and operations to create value through sustained operational improvement, where he oversees financial reporting, business intelligence and analytics.

Prior to joining Grain, Mr. Ashmore was an executive with Communications Management working exclusively with the Grain investment team and Grain portfolio companies on financial reporting, optimization, and analytics. Mr. Ashmore has over 20 years of experience in the global TMT sector, most recently serving in a variety of financial and general management roles at Cable & Wireless, now a subsidiary of Liberty Latin America. Previously, he held multiple senior level finance roles in Ireland, Australia, and in the Caribbean.

Education:

Mr. Ashmore holds a B.A. in Business Administration from John Moores University (Liverpool, UK) and is a Fellow of The Institute of Public Accountants (Australia).

About Grain Management:

Founded in 2007, Grain Management is a leading, global investment firm. We believe broadband and digital infrastructure are foundational to the tech-enabled transformation occurring across all industries and facets of society. Our global team of seasoned and diverse professionals share a collective passion for the power of connectivity to strengthen communities and unlock human potential for all.

We specialize in digital infrastructure and are a trusted solutions provider to the broadband and communications industry. Our unique combination of sector knowledge, experience as operators, and disciplined analytical approach guide our differentiated investment strategy across fiber networks, data centers, wireless spectrum, cell towers, as well as managed and infrastructure services.

Annie Asrari is an Operating Principal at Accel-KKR.

Prior to joining Accel-KKR, Annie was the Chief Product Officer at Castellan, where she led the positioning, grew Castellan’s product portfolio, and built a product management practice. During her tenure at Castellan, Annie directed Castellan’s product strategy from a single product to a platform approach, launched organic products, integrated M&A add-ons, and built and led migration plans. Castellan was acquired by Riskonnect, where Annie served as VP of Product Management and focused on company integration as well as leadership of additional product lines. Prior to Castellan and Riskonnect, Annie spent seven years at Everbridge building product strategy, launching and growing organic products, and integrating numerous acquisitions. Prior to Everbridge, Annie held Product Management positions at several technology companies.

Annie received an M.B.A. from Babson College, and a B.S. in Computer Engineering, from the University of Massachusetts, Dartmouth.

Accel-KKR’s culture is built on a strong work ethic and drive to succeed and is one that values integrity and collaboration. Our investment and operating professionals have extensive experience in the technology space. The team is disciplined in its investment approach and dedicated to helping our portfolio companies grow and succeed.

Geoff Baird is a Senior Operating Executive partnering with Palladium Equity in the technology sector. Working as an independent consultant he leverages extensive PE experience assisting sourcing of new investments and driving growth in their technology portfolio businesses.

Geoff is the Chairperson of Source Logistics, a Board Advisor and Operating partner at Envoy Global, a Board Member of Propeller Industries and an advisor to Fora Financial. Previously, Geoff was the Senior Managing Director of Value Creation at LLR Partners where he built a functional expert team of 12 people. Prior to joining LLR, Geoff was an operating executive at Tailwind Capital where he assisted in sourcing, evaluating and performing due diligence on investment opportunities. He served as a board member and active advisor to Tailwind portfolio companies Stratix Corporation (Chair), Diversified, AST and CoreBTS. In addition, Geoff was a board director at Worldaware, an LLR portfolio company. He also invests in early-stage technology companies as an angel investor and advisor.

Geoff’s leadership background is highlighted by several executive roles in the mobile, Internet of Things (IoT) and communications sectors. He previously served as President of the Product & Technology Group at AGT International, CEO of 3i-MIND, and Vice President and General Manager of the Small Medium Business Unit and the Communications Appliances Business Unit at Avaya. Earlier in his career, Geoff was the CEO of mobile technology firms Commtag and Xtempus, and COO of Psion Computing.

He received his MBA with distinction from the London Business School and a BSc in Cybernetics and Mathematics from the University of Reading, UK.

Since its founding in 1997, Palladium has invested in more than 220 companies (41 platforms and more than 180 add-ons). With over $3 billion in AUM, the firm focuses primarily on buyout equity investments in the range of $50 million to $150 million. Palladium seeks to acquire and grow companies in partnership with founders and experienced management teams by providing capital and strategic guidance. The partners of the firm have meaningful experience in consumer, services, industrials, and healthcare businesses, with a special focus on companies they believe will benefit from the growth in the U.S. Hispanic population. For more information, visit www.palladiumequity.com.

Brian Barnum is the Operating Partner at Shamrock Capital Advisors and works with Shamrock's portfolio companies to improve operations and increase value. He currently serves as a director of Skillable, Ad Results Media, and Maple Media and has worked closely with the management teams of Bayard Advertising, Adweek, Iyuno, Wpromote, Appetize, RB Media and Questex. Prior to joining Shamrock in 2017, Mr. Barnum held a number of senior executive roles for privately held media, communications and technology companies including COO of Brighter, Inc. (aquired by Cigna), COO/CFO of the Rubicon Project (now Magnite), the COO/CFO of Business.com and later the President of Dex Media's Digital businesses (now Thryv Holdings) after it acquired Business.com, the CFO of Rent.com through its acquisition by eBay (now RentPath), and the CFO of Transaction Network Services, which he guided through an IPO. Prior to his roles as an operating executive, Mr. Barnum worked in investment banking to media companies at Bankers Trust Company and to technology and communications companies at Alex. Brown & Sons.

Mr. Barnum has an MBA from the UCLA Anderson School of Management and has a BA in Economics from Stanford University.

Shamrock Capital Advisors, LLC is a Los Angeles-based investment firm with approximately $3.8 billion of assets under management. Shamrock Capital invests exclusively in media, entertainment, communications, and related sectors through a multi-fund strategy centered on private equity investments and entertainment intellectual property rights ownership. Shamrock Capital was originally founded in 1978 as the family investment company for the late Roy E. Disney and has since evolved into an institutionally backed firm with a leading group of investors, including endowments, foundations, and pension funds. Shamrock Capital partners with strong management teams and takes an active, collaborative approach to creating value in each investment. Shamrock Capital’s current private equity investments include Ad Results Media, Adweek, Bayard Advertising, Branded Cities, Canopy Spectrum, DeCurtis, Excel Sports Management, Iyuno-SDI Group, Learn on Demand Systems, Maple Media, Omega Wireless, Pixellot, SpotOn, and Wpromote. In addition, Shamrock Capital owns a diversified portfolio of premium content consisting of an economic interest in over 600 films, over 1,000 television episodes, and over 20,000 music compositions. For more information, visit Shamrockcap.com.

Alex Bello serves as Director of Technology Strategy at EQT, where he provides strategic support and advice to EQT’s investment teams and portfolio companies, focusing on technology, products, cybersecurity, and the application of AI to drive efficiency and innovation. EQT is a purpose-driven global investment organization with $250 billion AUM and three decades of developing companies across multiple geographies, sectors, and strategies covering all phases of a business’s development, from start-up to maturity.

Before joining EQT, Alex held various senior leadership roles in technology and product development, where he was instrumental in scaling businesses, driving revenue growth, and bringing innovative products to market. He has earned recognition for his contributions to software engineering and delivery, including being awarded a patent for continuous software deployment.

With over 20 years of experience in product and technology leadership, Alex began his career as a software engineer. His core expertise includes building highly scalable and secure software, optimizing R&D structures, driving growth through data-driven leadership and experimentation, and leading large-scale change initiatives to enhance operational efficiency and business performance.

Ted is an internationally-recognized expert on leadership and organization development. He advises investors, CEOs, and boards globally to help them position the right leaders for key roles and to support those leaders and teams for maximal value creation. Ted assists top performing organizations to anticipate and plan for future core business competencies and to install them in dynamic governance processes such as executive succession.

An organizational psychologist, human resources executive, management consultant and master coach for more than 30 years, Ted authors a bi-monthly leadership column in Chief Executive magazine and is also on the executive education faculty of the Harvard Business School. Ted has helped leaders around the world achieve enduring change in their organizations, their teams, and themselves by expanding their psychological, behavioral, and organizational insights into leadership.

Career Highlights: Ted Bililies, PhD:

• Internationally recognized expert on leadership and organization development

• Founded AlixPartners’ transformative leadership practice in 2014, advising global CEOs, their boards, and private equity investors

• Serving nearly three decades as an organizational psychologist, human resources executive, management consultant and master coach

• Executive Education faculty of the Harvard Business School and has held teaching appointments at Harvard University in four of Harvard’s graduate schools: Medical, Business, Arts & Sciences, and Extension

• Frequent speaker at leadership and investment conferences

• Featured in Fortune, The Wall Street Journal, Bloomberg, and CNBC’s Power and Money

• Author of bi-monthly leadership column in Chief Executive magazine

• Serves as exclusive advisor to the CEO of the Year Award committee

• Board Member, Perkins School for the Blind

• Board Member, Boston Graduate School of Psychoanalysis

• John Harvard Scholar, graduated magna cum laude from Harvard University

For nearly forty years, AlixPartners has helped businesses around the world respond quickly and decisively to their most critical challenges – circumstances as diverse as urgent performance improvement, accelerated transformation, complex restructuring and risk mitigation.

These are the moments when everything is on the line – a sudden shift in the market, an unexpected performance decline, a time-sensitive deal, a fork-in-the-road decision. But it’s not what we do that makes a difference, it’s how we do it.

Tackling situations when time is of the essence is part of our DNA – so we adopt an action-oriented approach at all times. We work in small, highly qualified teams with specific industry and functional expertise, and we operate at pace, moving quickly from analysis to implementation. We stand shoulder to shoulder with our clients until the job is done, and only measure our success in terms of the results we deliver.

Our approach enables us to help our clients confront and overcome truly future-defining challenges. We partner with you to make the right decisions and take the right actions. And we are right by your side. When it really matters.

Barr has created an unparalleled community of "been there, done that" technologists at Crosslake — setting the standard for technology leadership and guidance at the intersection of investment and private equity. He came to Crosslake from global management consulting firm McKinsey & Company, where he was Managing Partner of the firm's Charlotte, North Carolina office and served as a partner in the Transformation and Private Equity practices. Barr has extensive experience advising private equity firms, portfolio companies and Fortune 500 clients on strategic and transformational initiatives.

As advisors on 4,000+ private equity tech deals over the last four years, Crosslake is the firm investors call to understand what good looks like. The hands-on technical expertise of our 250+ practitioners is underscored by Crosslake’s objective TechIndicators®, based on thousands of prior M&A transactions. Our capabilities in tech due diligence, value creation and exit readiness are supported by accelerated delivery from our Build practice, cyber and risk solutions from our cybersecurity practice, and operational insights from our suite of proprietary, data-based applications.

From diligence through exit, we’ve helped more than 500 firms and 1,000 portfolio companies create value and make technology make a difference.

Will focuses on holistic, sustainable transformation of private equity investments. Most recently serving as a Chief Transformation Officer and Interim Chief Supply Chain Officer for a private equity backed consumer company. In this role, he turned around a company to structurally positive cash flow in one year post close whilst standing up the operations out of a global carveout. He also served as a Managing Director and Partner at AlixPartners advising and serving in interim roles for large scale private equity investors focused on operational transformation.

Experience includes:

Served as an Interim COO for a Tech-enabled CPG company.

Carved out a $500m CPG company from a multi-national conglomerate; stood up independent operations within 12 months including 3PL and IT ecosystem.

Served various PE clients across numerous transformation situations as an advisor and interim operating executive.

Will holds an MBA from the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania, a Bachelor of Science from the US Naval Academy. He has summitted Kilimanjaro, ran with the Bulls in Pamplona, and hiked the Inca Trail.

Tanoya Chatterjee is an Operating Partner on the Mubadala Performance Partner team, based in New York City. Mubadala is a sovereign investor with $302 Billion AUM. Tanoya leads go-to-market value creation initiatives for portfolio companies and due diligence workstreams for investment teams across all sectors. Tanoya has over 13 years of experience in both the operating and investing sides of private equity, including at firms such as KKR and Permira. She previously began her career in investment banking at Morgan Stanley. Tanoya holds a Bachelor’s degree and an MBA from The Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania.

Mubadala Investment Company is a sovereign investor managing a global portfolio, aimed at generating sustainable financial returns for the Government of Abu Dhabi.

Mubadala’s $276 billion (AED 1015 billion) portfolio spans six continents with interests in multiple sectors and asset classes. It leverages its deep sectoral expertise and long-standing partnerships to drive sustainable growth and profit, while supporting the continued diversification and global integration of the economy of the United Arab Emirates. For more information about Mubadala Investment Company, please visit: www.mubadala.com

Mr. Chesebrough, Operating Partner, joined New Mountain in 2022. Mr. Chesebrough has spent his entire career as a Growth Officer and Commercial Excellence executive, and he has worked in many industries in the B2B arena including: technology, discrete manufacturing, distribution, media, healthcare, and financial service. Prior to joining New Mountain, Mr. Chesebrough was an Operating Executive with TPG Capital from 2012 to 2021 where he was a leader on the Sales Effectiveness team. During his tenure at TPG, Mr. Chesebrough led sales transformations and turnarounds at a number of portfolio companies – where he often took the role of Acting CRO or Head of Sales Operations. Prior to TPG, Mr. Chesebrough held positions as Managing Director of the Revenue Enhancement practice at Alvarez & Marsal and Chief Revenue Officer at Corbis Corporation. He holds a BA in economics from Amherst College and an MBA from Harvard Business School. He is a Certified Turnaround Professional (CTP) and a former member of Board of Directors of the Turnaround Management Association (TMA).

Jim is a co-founder of Blue Ridge Partners and serves as the firm’s Managing Partner. For 35 years he has assisted companies in North America, Europe and Asia accelerate profitable revenue growth. Jim has advised over 300 companies on revenue-related issues including growth strategy, pricing, sales and marketing management and effectiveness, customer segmentation and messaging. Prior to founding Blue Ridge Partners, Jim was a Partner at both McKinsey & Company and Accenture. He was also the President of the worldwide professional services group at Unisys and the Managing Partner of AT＆T Solutions, the professional services arm of AT＆T. Jim previously served as Managing Partner of Potomac Partners and CEO of Luminant.

Blue Ridge Partners

Blue Ridge Partners is a management consulting firm exclusively focused on helping companies accelerate profitable revenue growth. We have worked with more than 1,000 companies to improve their strategic understanding of markets and customers, deepen and expand their customer relationships, and enhance marketing and sales performance.

Our clients include over 130 private equity firms and their portfolio companies –supporting them during deal evaluation, due diligence, and post-acquisition. We have a reputation for helping companies grow faster by rolling up our sleeves, working collaboratively, and delivering measurable impact quickly and more efficiently than large consultancies.

Adam Cummins is a Principal focused on Portfolio Procurement at The Carlyle Group. In his role (and as a seconded consultant for over nine years prior) Adam serves as the lead for Carlyle’s Global Portfolio Solutions Procurement team, overseeing strategic supplier partnerships and Procurement & Supply Chain, Employee Benefits and Corporate Risk related value creation opportunities for the benefit of Carlyle portfolio companies. Adam has over 23 years of outsourcing, strategic sourcing, contracts negotiations and program management experience. In addition to his time as a Procurement consultant with West Monroe Partners and Pace Harmon, he previously held several supply chain executive roles, including serving as the acting Chief Procurement Officer for a global IT outsourcer with over $7B in annual spend. Adam has a Bachelor’s Degree from the University of Virginia and a Master of Science in Supply Chain Management from the University of Tennessee’s Haslam School of Business.

The Carlyle Group (NASDAQ: CG) is a global investment firm with deep industry expertise that deploys private capital across three business segments: Global Private Equity, Global Credit and Investment Solutions. With $260 billion of assets under management as of March 31, 2021, Carlyle’s purpose is to invest wisely and create value on behalf of its investors, portfolio companies and the communities in which we live and invest. The Carlyle Group employs more than 1,800 people in 29 offices across five continents. Further information is available at www.carlyle.com. Follow The Carlyle Group on Twitter @OneCarlyle.

Sean is an accomplished Cybersecurity professional with almost 30 years of experience leading Cybersecurity teams for Global consulting firms in the United States and Australia. Early on, he recognized the impact of ransomware and began helping the industry to acknowledge the importance of focusing on recovering business operations – not just determining the who and how.

A technologist with deep expertise in infrastructure and application security, Sean has designed, implemented and defended complex environments across most industries. He has also provided forensic analysis on complex breaches for both corporate and government agencies. In addition, he has developed a business acumen that stems from advising Private Equity firms on hundreds of complex mergers and acquisitions transactions in particular Cybersecurity firms and products.

This blend of skills has put Sean in the board room, supporting dozens of large organizations in the midst of a ransomware attack, and advising executives as they navigate their organization to recovery.

Enduir Cyber is the leading cybersecurity firm focused on Private Equity value creation.

In today’s market of fast paced transactions, cross industry investments, and a focus on technology enablement; Private Equity firms need a cybersecurity partner that understands the complexities of the M&A lifecycle.

Enduir’s Private Equity Portfolio Resilience (PEPR) Program™ delivers value from pre-close diligence all the way through sell-side preparation. We closely tailor each PEPR program with the Operating Partner to mitigate risk and build Portfolio cyber resilience throughout the investment period. When cyber incidents do occur, Enduir provides a white-glove Incident Command service to respond, recover, and get the PortCo back to business.

Cory A. Eaves is a Partner and Head of Portfolio Operations at BayPine, where he leads the firm’s digital transformation and portfolio operations team. BayPine is a pioneering new private equity firm—one built from the ground up to bring digital transformation to companies in the healthcare, consumer, business services, and specialty industrials industries. Cory’s primary focus is on driving digital transformation initiatives within the firm and its portfolio companies. Before joining BayPine in 2023, Cory was one of the first Operating Partners at General Atlantic, where he built and scaled their portfolio value-add capability for nearly 15 years. Before joining General Atlantic, he was Executive Vice President, Chief Technology Officer, and Chief Information Officer at Misys plc. Earlier in his career, Cory also served as Chief Technology Officer of SSA Global, one of the world’s largest enterprise software providers, and various other technology leadership positions. Outside of his professional endeavors, Cory is active in a number of philanthropic activities, including The Marfan Foundation, where he serves as past Chairman and board member, and NetHope, where he serves as Board Fellow. Outside of work, Cory spends his time off-shore sailboat racing, snowboarding, and with his family in Larchmont, New York.

BayPine is a newly-formed private equity firm that seeks to make control and control-oriented equity investments in high-quality, market-leading businesses in traditional industries with the intent of facilitating a comprehensive digital transformation. Headquartered in Boston, BayPine was founded to instill durable core-economy companies with the execution speed, innovation mindset and technology infrastructure of leading “new economy” businesses. At the heart of the strategy is a pointed focus on digital enablement, a purpose-built team of investors and operators, and a differentiated value creation playbook that operationalizes each company’s full potential. For more information on BayPine, please visit www.baypine.com.

Richard Elder is a Managing Director-Partner and Head of Global Portfolio Solutions (GPS). He is based in Washington, D.C.

Prior to joining Carlyle, Mr. Elder served as Executive Vice President, Strategy & Growth and Chief Transformation Officer at Nouryon. He was responsible for helping to develop and integrate Nouryon’s Global Transformation program, with a focus on Strategy, Growth and Commercial Excellence. Prior to Nouryon, Mr. Elder spent 25-years at McKinsey & Company, where he was a senior partner in its Washington, D.C., office and a leader in its Transformation, Private Equity and Organization practices. He brings extensive experience in transformation processes and strategy development and has applied his private- and public-sector experience to help global industrial, manufacturing, aerospace, and defense organizations develop new strategies and implement large-scale transformations. He started his career as an officer for the US Air Force.

Mr. Elder has been a board member for more than 10 years with Athletes for Hope, which connects professional athletes with charitable causes.

Mr. Elder holds a B.S. in Mathematics from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology and an MBA with honors from the Darden School at the University of Virginia.

Andy Fauver is the Senior Vice President of Transaction Services at INSIGHT2PROFIT, where he leads the Transaction Services Practice. Andy partners with private equity firms, their portfolio companies, and other transaction advisors to add significant value to the M&A process by developing the data foundation and analytics, identifying enterprise value creation opportunities and risks, and crafting the growth roadmap and strategy. With over 25 years of consulting and commercial experience, Andy is a trusted advisor to private equity firms, their portfolio companies, and investment banks. He spearheaded the launch of INSIGHT’s Quality of Pricing® service offerings to support buy-side, exit planning, sell-side due diligence, and post-acquisition value creation.

Prior to joining INSIGHT, Andy founded and served as President of Freedonia Custom Research, a division of The Freedonia Group, providing growth consulting and market analytics to Global 1000 companies, private equity firms, and investment banks across a wide range of industries. He began his career with Ernst & Young and Capgemini, serving clients across industries with operational improvement and business transformation engagements, and led Sales Operations for Capgemini’s Technology Consulting group as part of The Leadership Development Program. Andy earned his MBA from Case Western Reserve University's Weatherhead School of Management and completed his B.A. in History from Hamilton College.

Michael Frain is based in New York, joined Warburg Pincus in 2008, leads the firm’s shared services program, which program helps portfolio companies drive strategy and value in areas such as procurement, employee benefits, corporate insurance and real estate. He is also a member of the firm’s Environmental, Social and Governance Committee. Prior to joining Warburg Pincus, Michael held various senior level finance positions at Racebrook Capital, Monday Properties and ATC Management. He holds a BBA in Accounting and an MBA in Finance from Baruch College.

Warburg Pincus LLC is a leading global growth investor. The firm has more than $83 billion in assets under management. The firm’s active portfolio of more than 225 companies is highly diversified by stage, sector, and geography. Warburg Pincus is an experienced partner to management teams seeking to build durable companies with sustainable value. Since its founding in 1966, Warburg Pincus has invested more than $117 billion in over 1,000 companies globally across its private equity, real estate, and capital solutions strategies. The firm is headquartered in New York with offices in Amsterdam, Beijing, Berlin, Hong Kong, Houston, London, Luxembourg, Mumbai, Mauritius, San Francisco, São Paulo, Shanghai, and Singapore. For more information, please visit www.warburgpincus.com. Follow us on LinkedIn.

Rory’s professional credentials have been built entirely within financial services technology delivery. His work has primarily focused on offsetting the inefficiencies created by the increasing gap between supply & demand in technology talent markets.

Recognizing that great people are central to the best business outcomes, Rory harnesses his Psychology background to create and implement tailored people-led solutions for Private Equity firms and their portfolio companies. This produces qualitative and quantitative efficiencies to technology delivery capability.

Recognizing the inherently unique demands of each firm Rory has been central in defining Saragossa products & services extending to; Project based Consultancy, Search & Selection and IT offshoring.

With an uncompromising dedication to delivering clear quantifiable improvements to business outcomes Rory has established a reputation as the trusted advisor to Technology leaders globally.

Saragossa is a Technology Solutions organisation with a proven track supporting Private Equity businesses, accelerating their portfolio companies. For nearly a decade we have provided support leading Private Equity organisations to maximise returns through rapid, specialised technology solutions. Providing strategic support alongside all of our core services: Project Delivery Consulting, Technology Outsourcing, Staffing, Executive Search, and 3rd party Talent Acquisition.

Having developed a reputation for unparalleled Private Equity domain expertise, we fully grasp the unique challenges presented managing an evolving technology business portfolio, responding rapidly to changing priorities and goals in a fiercely competitive landscape.

Our core values; Fearless, Uncompromising and Human underpin everything we do. We are brave, working outside of conventional methods to achieve agreed objectives, we do not compromise in our commitment to creating brilliant customer experiences, believing that great people are at the heart of every successful outcome.

Mr. Ganesan is a Managing Director within Oaktree Capital's Special Situation/Private Equity group. He specializes in driving commercial and operational performance improvement initiatives, including turnarounds, collaboratively with management teams. He joined Oaktree in 2017 from Yum! Brands, where he was the Vice President of Operations and corporate officer for the Taco-Bell division. He led operational and digital transformation of the 8,000 restaurant system. Prior thereto, he led Corporate & Business strategy and turnaround initiatives for both the Kimberly-Clark Corporation and Mattel, Inc. He was also an Engagement Manager with McKinsey & Company, where he served multiple Fortune 500 companies in the consumer, technology, manufacturing, medical devices, energy and financial sectors. Earlier in Mr. Ganesan’s career, he served as a 1st Lieutenant and field Artillery Officer of the Singapore Armed Forces. Mr. Ganesan received an M.B.A. from INSEAD Business School, a M.Sc. with highest distinction, and B.Sc. summa cum laude in mechanical engineering from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, and Purdue University, respectively.

Oaktree is a leader among global investment managers specializing in alternative investments, with $156 billion in assets under management as of June 30, 2021. The firm emphasizes an opportunistic, value-oriented and risk-controlled approach to investments in credit, private equity, real assets and listed equities. The firm has over 1,000 employees and offices in 19 cities worldwide. For additional information, please visit Oaktree’s website at http://www.oaktreecapital.com/.

As Head of Digital Value Creation, Mr. Ghai partners with Americas Private Equity investment teams, focusing on technology-related investment diligence and portfolio company value creation via digital transformation and technology modernization. He also supports the development and management of KKR's global portfolio technology platform.

Mr. Ghai oversees KKR’s global portfolio cyber risk program, manages relationships with strategic tech partners, and leads AI value creation efforts.

KKR is a leading global investment firm that offers alternative asset management and capital markets and insurance solutions. KKR aims to generate attractive investment returns by following a patient and disciplined investment approach, employing world-class people, and supporting growth in its portfolio companies and communities. KKR sponsors investment funds that invest in private equity, credit and real assets and has strategic partners that manage hedge funds. KKR’s insurance subsidiaries offer retirement, life and reinsurance products under the management of The Global Atlantic Financial Group. References to KKR’s investments may include the activities of its sponsored funds and insurance subsidiaries. For additional information about KKR & Co. Inc. (NYSE: KKR), please visit KKR’s website at www.kkr.com and on Twitter @KKR_Co.

KKR is a leading global investment firm that offers alternative asset management and capital markets and insurance solutions. KKR aims to generate attractive investment returns by following a patient and disciplined investment approach, employing world-class people, and supporting growth in its portfolio companies and communities. KKR sponsors investment funds that invest in private equity, credit and real assets and has strategic partners that manage hedge funds. KKR’s insurance subsidiaries offer retirement, life and reinsurance products under the management of The Global Atlantic Financial Group. We founded New State Capital to be more nimble, more decisive and more cooperative than bigger, institutional private investment firms.

We also think of ourselves as entrepreneurs, not just asset managers. In this context, we pride ourselves on our long-term outlook. We approach each potential investment as an opportunity to create a long lasting and valuable relationship. This is why our prior counterparties serve as our strongest advocates. Moreover, our firm started as an independent sponsor and as such we seek to support and provide services to independent sponsors.

Our success will be directly linked to the success of our portfolio companies individually. By contrast with other firms who have large, diverse portfolios, and who de-emphasize the importance of any given investment, our entrepreneurial approach maximizes the chances for shared success. This must-succeed attitude creates an alignment of interests with our management partners.

We have made a deliberate choice to employ an experienced team. Because our senior principals also execute our investments, we must be highly selective. This also allows us to be very decisive and flexible. We evaluate each company’s business and financial needs and create the structure that best fits the situation.

Critically, we are focused on growth. For example, we have executed fifteen add-on acquisitions – on average, nearly one for each platform company. We also try to balance our focus on growth with the realistic expectations of inevitable challenges.

Lee joined AEA Investors in 2019 and serves as an Operating Partner. In addition to providing oversight for the digital value creation function, Lee is also responsible for digital diligence with prospective investments as well as ongoing work with the firm’s existing portfolio companies. He is primarily focused on working with portfolio companies to assess, develop and identify opportunities to build value creation via digital initiatives.

Prior to AEA, Lee most recently served as Vice President of North America at Alibaba Group, leading the company’s North American initiatives. Prior to Alibaba, Lee was the first Global Head of Travel at Facebook, where he was responsible for developing the company’s monetization and growth strategy. Previously, Lee held various executive positions at Expedia, including overseeing APAC and North America where he led many supply optimization initiatives. Earlier in his career, Lee was part of the start-up office for eBay UK, where he helped drive eBay’s market penetration with several initiatives across supply, product, digital payments and platform trust and safety. Lee started his career with Warner Music in London.

Lee studied at Warwick Business School where he earned an MBA. He also earned an MA from Sheffield Hallam University in Media Production.

AEA Investors LP was founded in 1968 by the Rockefeller, Mellon and Harriman family interests and S.G. Warburg & Co. as a private investment vehicle for a select group of industrial family offices with substantial assets. AEA has an extraordinary global network built over many years which includes leading industrial families, business executives and leaders; many of whom invest with AEA as active individual investors and/or join its portfolio company boards or act in other advisory roles. Today, AEA’s approximately 100 investment professionals operate globally with offices in New York, Stamford, San Francisco, London, Munich and Shanghai. The firm manages funds that have nearly $15 billion of invested and committed capital including the leveraged buyouts of middle market companies and small business companies, growth capital and mezzanine and senior debt investments.

OMERS Private Equity has been an active private equity investor for over 20 years and its portfolio currently consists of investments in 20 industry-leading companies headquartered across the U.S., Canada, Europe and Asia.

Aaron Miller is a Partner in Apollo’s Private Equity business and Head of Apollo Portfolio Performance Solutions (APPS), where he oversees efforts to support its deal teams and the management of its funds’ portfolio companies to drive more successful investment outcomes and build stronger companies. Aaron serves on the boards of Avaya and Bellwether Education Partners. He received his MBA from Wharton and his BS in Chemical Engineering from Northwestern University and is fluent in both Spanish and Portuguese.

Sean is a former NY-based private equity partner turned entrepreneur, founder and CEO. Sean leveraged his years of experience investing in and supporting growth in data, network and information businesses to found BluWave and solve his own problem.

Brenda Morris, CGMA, CPA, MBA, is currently a partner with CSuite Financial Partners, a financial executive services firm. Entromy is the leading strategy and organizational insights technology company and platform focused on helping Private Equity owned companies achieve results. The Entromy Insights Platform leverages cutting-edge natural language processing capabilities to synthesize insights for real-time organizational health visibility to support business due diligence, PMI, business transformations, rapid growth of distributed teams, and overall business performance.

As co-founder and managing partner of Acertitude, Kevin is dedicated to unlocking the full potential of today's leading organizations by discovering, connecting, and empowering brilliant leaders.

With a 25+ year career in executive search, he has earned the reputation as a trusted advisor to global board members, CEOs, and C-suite executives, having led more than 2,000 searches for prominent companies and private equity firms worldwide.

Acertitude’s success builds on Kevin’s establishment and leadership of O’Neill Consulting, an Acertitude company, which now specializes in senior management search, which he founded in 1996. Acertitude is the executive search firm unleashing human potential for private equity firms and portfolio companies globally. Michael recognizes that an effective response requires an integrated approach with blended skillsets across the incident command, forensics, containment, recovery, and remediation work-streams. He has almost 25 years of technology and cybersecurity experience in both industry & global consulting.

After spending many years building and leading programs to defend GE’s intellectual property against advanced threats, he co-founded managed detection and response (MDR) firm Morphick, which was recognized by Gartner as a “pioneer” in the MDR services market and ranked among the top firms to hold the NSA CIRA accreditation for incident response services.

Following the acquisition of Morphick by Booz Allen Hamilton, Michael led cybersecurity practices for global consulting firms, advising clients on cybersecurity strategy, incident response, and M&A transactions.

Enduir Cyber is the leading cybersecurity firm focused on Private Equity value creation.

In today’s market of fast paced transactions, cross industry investments, and a focus on technology enablement; Private Equity firms need a cybersecurity partner that understands the complexities of the M&A lifecycle.

Enduir’s Private Equity Portfolio Resilience (PEPR) Program™ delivers value from pre-close diligence all the way through sell-side preparation. We closely tailor each PEPR program with the Operating Partner to mitigate risk and build Portfolio cyber resilience throughout the investment period. When cyber incidents do occur, Enduir provides a white-glove Incident Command service to respond, recover, and get the PortCo back to business.

Adam specializes in enterprise value creation, deal execution, technology enabled business transformation, operational diligence, divestiture/carve-out, technology integration and convergence, enterprise systems optimization, organizational and operating model development
